channel.title: Pleasure Monkey Podcast
channel.itunes:summary:
Do you ever find yourself asking “What the f*ck are we doing here?”... Good… Us too.
On the PMP we seek out individuals that are living fulfilling lives through an Authentic Expression of their values and let them tell their stories, challenge ideas, and share their perspective in hopes of helping all of us figure out WTF we're doing and how to create a fulfilling experience.
channel.itunes:author: Conner Moore: Consciousness Explorer and Pleasure Advocate
channel.description:
On The Realness, the only thing off limits is bullsh*t.
Conner and his guests explore the beautiful mess that we call life with unapologetic authenticity and no shortage of strong language. Unedited, ridiculous, and impactful all wrapped up in one big sexy show.
Hit subscribe if you want to live the f*ck out of life.

item.title: 49: Life's A Dance with Kirsten Asher
item.itunes:title: Life's A Dance with Kirsten Asher
item.description:
In a world that glorifies “hustle” and “grind”, Kirsten helps others “embody” and “flow”. Through dance, she creates a space for women to explore their bodies and take ownership of their feminine freedom with her company FEMethod. On this episode, we explore the dynamics of the masculine and feminine in life, love, and sex.

 

To keep up with Kirsten, check out FEMethod.com and follow her on Instagram @kirstenashernow.

item.title: 48: Influence vs. Manipulation with Liz Germain
item.itunes:title: Influence vs. Manipulation with Liz Germai
item.description:
Liz has created a life designed to teach other to step into their full potential. From fitness and nutrition to building an online business, Liz has you covered. Her passion is driven by understanding individuals and meeting them where they are to inspire action. In this episode with talk about the difference between manipulation and influence, how to deal with narcissism, and sharing a full version of how yourself with the world around you.

item.title: 47: Ayahuasca and Self-Awareness with Rob Dial
item.itunes:title: Ayahuasca and Self-Awareness with Rob Dial
item.description:
If you’re into meditation, psychedelics, and empathy then you’re into this episode. Rob Dial broke away from corporate America and has created a life full of developing motivational content to help others live fully. Rob shares his experience with Ayahuasca and the profound impact it has had on his approach to personal development. We discuss the role psychedelics have had on our compassion practice and awareness of how we bring ourselves to the world.

 

To learn more about Rob, check out the MWF Motivation Podcast and his Facebook Page.

 

For info on working with Conner one-on-one and a free 30-minute video chat, check out the Lifestyle Design Program.

item.title: 46: Love The Work with Matt Vincent
item.itunes:title: Love The Work with Matt Vincent
item.description:
Matt is one of the most interesting human being I’ve ever met. From winning The Highland Games to founding HVIII Brand Goods to starting the UMSO Podcast, he is always making something happen. Matt immerses himself in the process and, as a result, his results are incredible. On this episode we talk about the importance of creating a life full of work that you love, the power of sacrifice, and what it feels like to open-hand slap a grown man.

 

To keep up with Matt, check out the UMSO Podcast and HVIII Brand Goods (promo code “monkey will get you 15% off)

item.title: 45: Posture, Sexual Expression, and Self-Exploration with Aaron Alexander
item.itunes:title: Posture, Sexual Expression, and Self-Exploration with Aaron Alexander
item.description:
Aaron Alexander is a movement and body expert, host the The Align Podcast, and a pretty radical thinker. On this episode we talk about how shame manifests itself physically, the power of giving, the practice of exploring yourself and your internal biases, and the effects of body position on your mental and emotional state. Aaron is the type of guy that is always learning and exploring new mental, emotional, and physical practices. He’s got a great sense for what works and doesn’t take himself too seriously, which makes for really fun conversation.

By the way, we reference The Multiorgasmic Man and 12 Rules For Life a lot on this one… I recommend picking these up.

 

Keep up with Aaron’s adventures by subscribing to the Align Podcast and aligntherapy.com.

 

To support Pleasure Monkey Nation, check out the Patreon Page and show sponsors to get some sweet discounts:

Aaron is the type of guy that is always learning and exploring new mental, emotional, and physical practices. He’s got a great sense for what works and doesn’t take himself too seriously, which makes for really fun conversation.

By the way, we reference The Multiorgasmic Man and 12 Rules For Life a lot on this one… I recommend picking these up.

 

Keep up with Aaron’s adventures by subscribing to the Align Podcast and aligntherapy.com.

item.title: 43: Money, Psychedelics, and Environmental Consciousness with Kyle Thiermann
item.itunes:title: Money, Psychedelics, and Environmental Consciousness with Kyle Thiermann
item.description:
Kyle Thiermann is a professional surfer, documentary filmmaker, TEDx speaker, and podcast host with one hell of a life journey and a knack for sharing it with others. On this episode we explore our biggest failures in life and the power they have had on our experiences, how psychedelics help us create massive breakthroughs, and why we seems to overlook the environmental impacts of our actions. I loved this conversation and I think you will too.

To learn more about Kyle, check out kyle.surf and The Kyle Thiermann Show.

Also, check out his complete bio here if you want to impressed with another human:

Kyle Thiermann, born 1990, is a professional surfer and filmmaker from Santa Cruz, CA.

When he's not chasing building-sized waves around the globe he works with Discovery Digital Networks as an on-camera correspondent and producer. He also works closely with his main sponsor, Patagonia to beat up products and help implement solutions to the environmental crisis.

From ages 18-25 Kyle created and hosted the YouTube series Surfing For Change. While traveling to the best waves around the world, Thiermann created gonzo-style mini-documentaries about current environmental issues happening in the regions. In the series, Thiermann focused on the power people have to create a better world through everyday decisions.

His first YouTube video in the series details how money kept in multinational banks can be used to finance destructive projects all over the world. This video inspired people to move over $360 million dollars of lending power out of centralized banks and into local banks and credit unions, and reached people throughout North America, South America, Africa and much of Europe.

Kyle has covered controversial stories all over the world. These stories have included the Indonesian trash epidemic, GMO protests in Hawaii, working conditions in Sri Lanka, nuclear power in South Africa, and the adverse effects of surf tourism in Nicaragua.

He graduated from Gaia University with a Bachelors of Science in Green Business with a focus in Media. His surfing skills earned him a spot among an elite group of athletes on the teams of Patagonia and Sector 9.

Kyle frequently appears on the pages of publications such as Surfer Magazine, Outside Magazine, and is a contributing writer for The Inertia and Santa Cruz Waves.

Kyle Speaks at Universities throughout the country and in 2011 gave a TEDx Talk in his wetsuit. Kyle’s surfing and filmmaking successes have earned him the Brower Youth Award, American Clean Skies Award, Blue Vision Youth Award, and Surfrider’s Pro Surfer Environmental Achievement Award

 

---

item.title: 36: Take Ownership Through Reflection with Kyle Kingsbury
item.itunes:title: Taking Ownership Through Reflection with Kyle Kingsbury
item.description:
Kyle Kingsbury is the Director of Human Optimization at Onnit and host of the Onnit Podcast. He got this role by be relentless in his pursuit of physical, mental, and personal development. We explore the lessons we learned in 2017 and how we are going to use them to guide us in 2018. We talk about the importance of reflection, some of the most impactful books we read in 2017, as well as the takeaways from our psychedelic adventures over the past year. I’m extremely grateful for what Kyle has brought to my life and absolutely love when we get a chance to record together. Enjoy the show!

item.title: 33: Sex, Relationships, and Threesome Tips with Allie Waddell
item.itunes:title: Sex, Relationships, and Threesome Tips with Allie Waddell
item.description:
We all have sexual desires, but the ability to communicate and express them in a healthy way can cause some friction (and not the good kind). On this episode, Alli and I explore how we’ve learned to find sexual outlets that allow us to explore while maintaining balanced relationships with others and ourselves.

We dive into using sexuality as an avoidance strategy or a means of leverage, how self-awareness fuels a fulfilling sex life, and how to have a good threesome. It’s quite a show, my friends.

item.itunes:title: See Yourself (and your bullsh*t) with Alli Waddell

item.title: 30: Compassion, Expectations, and Working Inward with Mike Salemi
item.description:
After wrapping up this show, Mike and I looked at each other with a “what the hell just happened?” expression. We both agree that this is one of the most authentic and well articulated pieces or work that either of us have ever done. Mike showed up and allowed himself to be authentic, raw, and expressive while I held the intention to do the same.

We dive into the transition from working out to working in, what it means to be aligned and fulfilled by life, how to close the gap between expectation and reality, healthy masculine and feminine expression, our lessons and path with plant medicines, and so much more. This was truly an amazing experience and I’m beyond grateful to share it with all of you.

To see what Mike is up to, check him out on Instagram or join his mailing list at mikesalemi.io.

item.description:
Cory Allen is one of the most interesting human beings I’ve ever experienced. He has cultivated a view of life and mindfulness that allows others to explore their consciousness with light-heartedness and curiosity. On this show we explore the modern “spiritual” landscape while doing our best to not sound like douchebags… I feel like we did a pretty good job, but you can be the judge of that.

Cory does some amazing work. You can find him hosting the Astral Hustle, running the Release Into Now meditation course, or cranking out some righteous Binaural Beats.

Mark England, the language gangster, is back to share his experience with some of the most potent and effective psychedelics on the planet. After the psychedelic chat we jump down the rabbit hole of using play and finding the parts of life that fuel your soul to create the ultimate flow of life.

item.title: 25: You’re Not Broken with Bryan Edmund
item.description:
Addiction takes many shapes and Bryan has experienced a few of them. His courage to face the fear and accept the love of those around him as led him to a life full of helping others accomplish their dreams while, in turn, creating his best life. We dive into how fear can be an addiction, the false-beliefs and shame that can limit our growth, and how to leverage your mindset to create your best future.  

 

You can check out Bryan on his podcast, The Sobriety Network, or check out his marketing company, Unanonymous.

item.title: 22: Love, Communication, and Sexual Expression with Liv Langdon
item.description:
Communication, sexual expression, and a judgment-free environment are all huge components to a lasting relationship. It's no secret that we aren't exactly taught how to accomplish a mindset of growth and openness in a romantic relationship and taking a stand to create a partnership based on your true self can make all the difference.  

But how? Where do we start?  

Liv and I share our story, talk through some of our most impactful areas of growth and how the development of our honest communication has affected our relationship. Some vulnerable moments are shared and we hope they help you create an authentic and expressive relationship. 

You can find Liv on instagram @livlangdon, on her website livlangandprosper.com, or on the Onnit youtube channel

item.title: 19: Own Your Movement with Aaron Alexander
item.description:
Aaron Alexander is a movement philosopher on a mission to inspire

millions of driven individuals to confidently re-inhabit their bodies to be strong, flexible and pain-free by moving functionally during every daily task. On a global scale, we’re reversing the effects of chair slumping and screen staring by helping you build your own momentary physical practice.

He hosts the Align Podcast and has one of the most epic guest lineups in Podcast history. On this show, we discuss perception and reflections, patterns in life, the power of movement, and the silly things we do as humans.

To check out all of Aaron’s work, check out AlignTherapy.com

item.title: 14: Started From The Bottom Now We Here with Jill Coleman, Danny Johnson and Aaron Alexander
item.description:
On this episode we are hanging out with Jill Coleman, Danny Johnson, and Aaron Alexander talking shame, being present, expectations, and romantic energy. We all circled up around Jill’s living room with a few glasses of wine and let loose. This might be my favorite podcast yet… Enjoy :)

You can find them at;

Aligntherapy.com

JillFit.com

DannyJ.com

 

A little bit about these beautiful badasses:

Aaron Alexander has been professionally working with clients of all ages seeking a variety of goals from pain relief to improved athletic performance for over 10 years. He is currently seeing clients at his office, Align Therapy, in downtown Bend, Oregon. Aaron began the journey as a nationally certified personal trainer specializing in corrective exercise and nutrition consultation. During that time Aaron studied psychology at the University of Hawaii. Soon after, he evolved into becoming a licensed manual therapist studying myofascial release, neuromuscular therapy and trigger point therapy at Maui School of Therapeutic Massage. A fascination with connective tissue lead him to study structural integration at the Rolf Institute in Boulder, CO. Being a LMT and CPT on top of a Rolf Structural Integration Practitioner, Aaron has a strong understanding of the intricacies of the body and mind.

 

Danny Johnson, is a high-energy speaker who can dish it to you straight, but with just enough sugar to make you want more. Danny-J, is a serial entrepreneur who has created multiple successful brands and online businesses with one underlying principle: “Make People More Awesome(r).” She won Ali Brown’s 2012 Entrepreneur of the year award, lived through being paralyzed at age 22 and was a suicidal and pregnant teen, with quite a turnaround story. She owned a very successful personal training and online-training business, No Excuses Fitness, and has helped thousands of people lose tens to hundreds of pounds. She coached fitness competitors to the stage and has even graced the stage as a National Level Athlete and Fitness Magazine Cover Model herself.

Jill Coleman is the founded JillFit.com in 2010, I was a co-founder of Metabolic Effect, Inc. Her 16-year journey in the health and fitness industry began when she got her very first job at a gym just for the free membership at 15!

Since then, her life has been a been a whirlwind of education in exercise science and nutrition, fitness competitions, landing several national covers for fitness modeling and plenty of business growth. Her work has been featured in SELF magazine, Family Circle, SHAPE, Women’s Health magazine, Prevention magazine and many online news outlets like Yahoo Health, LiveStrong.com and AOL’s That’s Fit.

Her passion lies in coaching in the areas of mindset, body and business, which I do via my flagship program, The Best Of You (BOY) Coaching Club mentorship, as well as a few signature online programs, like the Mindset Makeover, the Food Obsession Boot Camp and my 52-week exercise program, the Total Training Experience (TTE).

Soon after, he evolved into becoming a licensed manual therapist studying myofascial release, neuromuscular therapy and trigger point therapy at Maui School of Therapeutic Massage. A fascination with connective tissue lead him to study structural integration at the Rolf Institute in Boulder, CO. Being a LMT and CPT on top of a Rolf Structural Integration Practitioner, Aaron has a strong understanding of the intricacies of the body and mind.

 

Danny Johnson, is a high-energy speaker who can dish it to you straight, but with just enough sugar to make you want more. Danny-J, is a serial entrepreneur who has created multiple successful brands and online businesses with one underlying principle: “Make People More Awesome(r).” She won Ali Brown’s 2012 Entrepreneur of the year award, lived through being paralyzed at age 22 and was a suicidal and pregnant teen, with quite a turnaround story. She owned a very successful personal training and online-training business, No Excuses Fitness, and has helped thousands of people lose tens to hundreds of pounds. She coached fitness competitors to the stage and has even graced the stage as a National Level Athlete and Fitness Magazine Cover Model herself.

Jill Coleman is the founded JillFit.com in 2010, I was a co-founder of Metabolic Effect, Inc. Her 16-year journey in the health and fitness industry began when she got her very first job at a gym just for the free membership at 15!

Since then, her life has been a been a whirlwind of education in exercise science and nutrition, fitness competitions, landing several national covers for fitness modeling and plenty of business growth. Her work has been featured in SELF magazine, Family Circle, SHAPE, Women’s Health magazine, Prevention magazine and many online news outlets like Yahoo Health, LiveStrong.com and AOL’s That’s Fit.

Her passion lies in coaching in the areas of mindset, body and business, which I do via my flagship program, The Best Of You (BOY) Coaching Club mentorship, as well as a few signature online programs, like the Mindset Makeover, the Food Obsession Boot Camp and my 52-week exercise program, the Total Training Experience (TTE).

item.title: 9: How to Have Everything and Need Nothing with Mike Bledsoe
item.description:
Mike Bledsoe is an entrepreneur, the co-host and co-founder of Barbells Shrugged and Barbell Business, host of The Bledsoe Show, and all-around interesting as f*ck. He leads his life with a kind of curiosity that can either get you in a lot of trouble, create a lot of success, or (in his case) both. In this conversation we talk about how he started his career and discuss the pivotal moments throughout his life that he credits with his unique perspective.

To see more from Mike and his team, check out BarbellShrugged.com and go give a The Bledsoe Show a listen.

Jill Coleman and Danny Johnson share a passion for creating a life on their own terms. Fortunately for the rest of us, they also have the desire to help others do the same. They both found their way from magazine covers to coaching others  in the art of mindset, financial freedom, body and business. It this conversation we discuss how to share an authentic story, the lessons learned from our relationships (past and present), what the term “soulmate” means to us, and basically solve all of the world’s problems.

JillFit.com and DannyJ.com

item.description: Jeremy Hills is the Director of Sports Performance at the Onnit Academy and an incredibly inspiring and talented individual. He has created an amazing career for himself as a performance coach for some of the best players in the NFL as well as some up-and-coming athletes that will be making waves on Sundays to come. Jeremy’s life is one full of gratitude and compassion and he is fueled by the desire to bring his best self to his work “every damn day” in the hopes to bring the best out of all of those around him.
